Related Publication.Citation: Mackie, AS, Rempel, GR, Kovacs, AH, Kaufman, M, Rankin, KN, Jelen, A, Manlhiot, C, Anthony, SJ, Magill-Evans, J, Nicholas, D, Sananes, R, Oechslin, E, Dragieva, D, Mustafa, S, Williams, E, Schuh, M, McCrindle, BW (2016). A cluster randomized trial of a transition intervention for adolescents with congenital heart disease: rationale and design of the CHAPTER 2 study. BMC Cardiovascular Disorders, 16, 127.

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: This project will determine whether a nurse-led transition intervention program is better at preparing teens with Congenital Heart Disease (CHD) to independently manage their medical care, compared to the care that is currently provided. The most important finding of this study will be whether or not these teens subsequently attend the adult cardiology clinic that specializes in CHD problems, and the timing of when they attend.

Grant Information.grantNumber:Grant Agency: Heart and Stroke Foundation of Canada; Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR); Mazankowski Alberta Heart Institute

ore:describes.socialscience:Actions to Minimize Losses: There will be follow-up communication if questionnaires are not returned.
ore:describes.Data Sources: Transition Readiness Assessment Questionnaire (TRAQ); MyHeart Scale; Williams Scale
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
ore:describes.socialscience:Frequency: Questionnaire data will be collected at 1, 6, 12, and 18 months. Chart reviews will occur at baseline, and excess time to first ACHD clinic appointment will be accessed 12 and 24 months post enrollment. Cardiologist's assessment of readiness to transition will be tracked at the first appointment post-enrollment. Qualitative data will be collected after each session (nursing intervention log) and 1 week post session (texts and emails).
Related Datasets: Evaluation of Novel Transition for Youth with Congenital Heart Disease (CHAPTER I)
The CHAPTER III Study of Young Adolescents: Congenital Heart Adolescents Participating in Transition Evaluation Research
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure: The sample size is based on testing group differences in excess time to adult congenital heart disease (ACHD) care, with a two-sided log-rank test. A sample size of 60 patients per group (120 total) will allow detection of a difference between 90 and 70 %, the proportions that have attended their first ACHD clinic appointment by the end of the observation period in the intervention and usual care groups, respectively, with 80+% power, accounting for the 'design effect' due to the cluster randomization of the trial. Patients were assigned to groups through block randomization with the unit of randomization being week.
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: 16 and 17 year old adolescents with moderate or complex congenital heart disease (CHD).
ore:describes.socialscience:Other Forms of Data Apprai: The control group was less responsive than the intervention group.
ore:describes.Kind of Data: Questionnaire data; Clinical data; Qualitative data
ore:describes.Title: The CHAPTER II Study: Congenital Heart Adolescents Participating in Transition Evaluation Research
ore:describes.socialscience:Control Operations: Field validation is built into REDCap data collection forms.
ore:describes.socialscience:Collection Mode: Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Self-administered questionnaire: Web-based; Self-administered writings and/or diaries; Chart review
ore:describes.schema:name: The CHAPTER II Study: Congenital Heart Adolescents Participating in Transition Evaluation Research

access.

dvcore:fileTermsOfAccess.dvcore:availabilityStatus: Data is not available because the study is still ongoing.
